subject: Public Speaking
title: Post-Event Rumination
description: A short lesson to help you apply Post-Event Rumination.

hook.text: The speech is over. It went fine. But at 3 AM, you're replaying every awkward pause on an infinite loop.

buildup.text: Post-event rumination is when your brain reviews a social event and selectively focuses on everything that went wrong.

discovery.text: Research shows ruminators reconstruct events as worse than they actually were. Memory distorts under anxiety.

twist.text: People who ruminate after speeches develop more fear before the next one. It's a self-reinforcing anxiety cycle.

climax.text: Breaking the cycle requires recognizing that your 3 AM review is unreliable â€” it's anxiety editing your memories.

punchline.text: Your midnight replay is fiction wearing the costume of memory.

quiz.question: What happens during post-event rumination?
options: Your brain selectively focuses on negatives and distorts the memory
